title: Work-Integrated Learning (WIL) Design for Industrial Doctoral Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate science domain expertise and practical work experience
context.additional_context: As a current practitioner, balancing research tasks with fieldwork in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment while progressing through learning

learning_goals: Learners independently design academically and practically integrated research topics using industry data and networks
Learners can establish and implement context-specific transition strategies while balancing the roles of researcher and practitioner.
Learners can identify ethical issues arising in industry-university collaboration processes and propose solutions.

resources: Industry Field Data Samples for Case Analysis
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
